intro: Dracaena penangensis, commonly known as the Penang dracaena, is a flowering plant native to the island of Penang in Malaysia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters at the base of the leaves. Dracaena penangensis is typically found in tropical rainforests, growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
